thread.title: Hallman, Shumake lead runners at Coweta Cup
thread.title_full: Hallman, Shumake lead runners at Coweta Cup

title: Hallman, Shumake lead runners at Coweta Cup
text:
Hallman, Shumake lead runners at Coweta Cup Sunday, October 18, 2015 Comments 
Boys runners from Newnan, East Coweta and Northgate take off from the starting line during Saturday’s Coweta Cup race at East Coweta High School. 
This year’s Coweta Cup cross-country championships took on a different look, both among the course and the lineups. 
East Coweta hosted the event for the first time in recent memory, taking advantage of its acreage of athletic facilities on campus to set up a 5K course. 
Both host lineups took advantage of familiar surroundings while capturing Saturday’s team trophies. 
Northgate, though, didn’t have its regular lineup in either race, sending its top-7 runners to the 13th annual Coach Wood Invitational at Gainesville College. The Vikings finished first and the Lady Vikings placed sixth overall. 
East Coweta and Newnan split individual accolades on Saturday. Newnan senior Mary Douglass Hallman captured the girls title for the Lady Cougars, while Indians senior Matthew Shumake led the boys race. 
In JV events, Newnan won the girls event. 
All three schools continue to prepare for upcoming region meets starting next week. The Region 4- meet, hosted by Starr’s Mill, will take place at Heritage Christian Church in Fayetteville on Saturday. 
Newnan will host the 3- meet on Oct. 31 at the Newnan Utilities reservoir near Carl Miller Park while joined by East Coweta. 
Official results of Saturday’s Coweta Cup were unavailable at deadline. More
